div.h2: WELCOME TO THE sCHOOL dISTRICT OF wASHINGTON

span.style: text-align: left; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; text-decoration: none; word-spacing: 0px; display: inline !important; white-space: normal; float: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: transparent; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);
span.span:
The School District of Washington is rich in tradition and we are proud of our accomplishments. Continuous improvement remains our focus and desire each and every day. We commit to the growth of student learning, behavior, citizenship, participation and service. Our high expectations of students are a reflection of how much we value them. Email comments and suggestions about the website to craig.vonderhaar@washington.k12.mo.us.
​

div.h3: Public Comments During Virtual Board Meetings
div.hr:
Due to COVID-19 and the state-wide Stay-At-Home order currently in place, it has been necessary to switch to virtual board meetings for the time being. In order to continue to accommodate our District patrons, public comments relating to an item on the current month's agenda may be emailed to comments@washington.k12.mo.us. Please submit comments by 4:00 PM CST on the day prior to the board meeting.
Wednesday, May 27 Meeting, 7 p.m.
Join Zoom Meeting
Meeting ID:

div.div: The School District of Washington has come up with rescheduled dates for Washington High School Prom and Graduation.

a.title: School District of Washington Closed for Remainder of Academic Year

div.a: School District of Washington Closed for Remainder of Academic Year
div.div: On the afternoon of Thursday, April 9, Missouri Governor Mike Parson ordered that all Missouri public and charter schools remain closed through the rest of the academic year.
